newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombia's Bancoldex wins $100 mln loan.
newsitem.headline: Colombia's Bancoldex wins $100 mln loan.

text.p: Colombia's foreign trade bank Banco de Comercio Exterior (Bancoldex) has arranged a syndicated loan of $100 million over eight years, its chairman Gabriel Turbay said Wednesday.
The loan is being arranged through Citibank, Dresdner Bank and Japan's IBJ at an interest rate of LIBOR plus 0.85 percent, Turbay told Reuters.
It is the first syndicated loan Bancoldex has secured and it will be used to finance a long-term export program and to secure further credits for transport infrastructure projects.
Bancoldex has previously issued Eurobonds and Samurai bonds over five years worth a total $220 million.
